App Title: Five Nights at Freddy's: Help Wanted
App description:
Five Nights at Freddys: Help Wanted is a virtual reality experience for the Oculus Quest. FNaF: HW is a collection of classic and original mini-games set in the Five Nights universe. Survive terrifying encounters with your favorite killer animatronics in a collection of new and classic FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDYS experiences. Where fantasy and fun come to life!


YOURE HIRED - Repair claustrophobic ventilation systems, troubleshoot broken animatronics that could activate at any moment, or spend your evenings cowering in the nighttime security guard office. 
CELEBRATE - Confront your favorite killer animatronics including; Freddy, Bonnie, Chica, Foxy, Springtrap, The Mangle, Funtime Foxy, and Circus Baby. 
PIZZA PARTY - Scenes from classic titles have been updated for an immersive VR experience including;  Five Nights at Freddys, Five Nights at Freddys 2, Five Nights at Freddys 3, Five Nights at Freddys 4,  and Five Nights at Freddys: Sister Location.

Xylon-cryptic24 days ago
! Read this if you are having problems !

Heres some tips if youre having problems


( height ) :Ive seen people complain about their feet going through the floor and not being able to press buttons. But in this game, if you press the left joysticks up or down, that should change your height in game.


( wobbling) :when you move your head in a fast pace and stop abruptly, the camera will wobble a bit.
I suggest you move you head in a slow pace so its barely visible. Itll be removed soon so just be patient. ( I hope.....)



( loss data ) :for this, you should always cloud sync every time you play and never to click launch app without syncing it. If the game closes and it says launch app its okay to click it because you were just playing the game and it wont lose any progress.



Theres more problems but those are some of the more common.

JogoLordJul 18 at 9:04 AM
Im so glad this is as good as it is

I just want to warn: This is going to be more of a personal piece than a review due to my long connection to the series. The first half will just be me explaining where I am with FNaF.

If you do have the time, please read it. If you dont, I pretty much wrapped up my thoughts in the final paragraph, although it would make more sense if you saw the rest. Just let me say this game is 100% worth it.

I dont remember how I first found Scratch. As you probably would know, its a simple kids programming language for children to learn the concepts for real coding, and to share their creations. Despite it only being a starter language, I stuck with it for very long, until I was pretty much fluent.

When it comes to fangames, FNAF has always been very allowing of it. This means many developers, or even younger children, are free to create a game inspired by it.

Scratch was a perfect example of this, (despite the new anti- horror game policy.) So many people made their own little FNaF clones.

And I was one of them.

When coding and playing other peoples games, however, I began learning a pattern in many projects. They always used similar animatronic AI, the same sound effects, tropes, and far too many uninspired jumpscares.

So due to this, I learned literally every thing about the original FNAF games, and became completely desensitised at a very young age.

It had gotten to the point where I knew every sound effect, song, mechanic, voice & trope and could recognise it immediately.

So its incredible how despite knowing literally everything about this series, story wise and gameplay wise,
FNaF: Help Wanted still absolutely floors me. Everything just works. Its an absolute testament to the series and I am so glad I get to experience it.

Well done Steel Wool!

PigG13Jul 20 at 9:55 PM
Unimaginably Terrifying!

When I began playing this game for the Oculus Quest, I had seen just about every YouTube video there is about this game. From lets plays to theories, I knew what I was getting myself into. Or, so I thought. When watching gameplay of this game, I could always know that everything was going to be okay, and that the funny bunnies or bears were just pictures on a screen. But, I was WRONG. This game is so scary that I cant play it for more than about 10 minutes without feeling like shriveling up in a corner and just weeping. It feels *real*. Like, Bonnie is *literally* standing next to me, or Foxy is *actually* running towards me to *actually* kill me. I forget Im just playing a game. However, that is what makes this game so good. This game completely captivates me and puts me in this terrifying experience for me to enjoy. It literally takes my breath away from me at just how amazing the experience is. With a family member near, or a friend watching me play, I gain the full confidence I need to play this game to the fullest, with half hour to hour playing sessions of just pure joy and horror. This may be the scariest thing Ive ever played, but that doesnt mean it loses any credit to how breathtakingly fun it can be. Thank you Steel Wool Studios and Scott Cawthon for the incredible experience!

C4_SquishyBoiJul 24 at 11:01 AM
Incredible Work

This game was amazing. I just played through the whole game and it was great. The visuals were stunning, and overall very scary. The feeling of claustrophobia in some of the levels makes it scarier, not to mention the enormous robots trying to kill me. Overall the levels were well designed to keep you scared and on your toes. I especially liked the ones that were made for VR, such as the Parts and Service and Vent Repair. They really do give you the spooks. And there is a bit of humor thrown in there as
a break from the horror as the voice making funny remarks and the collectables being cute or funny. Entirely, I give it a 10/10. 100% recommend for anyone who is looking for a scary game, or just anyone looking for a game to play. This game is especially fun to play with family or friends as you can have fun watching your friends/family get scared, as you too. It does take a bit to fully complete the game, but I do recommend if you want to have a good time, be it on your own, or with others.

Note: There is a bit of a jiggly effect, but I think that adds to the spooky effect of the game.

Note 2: On the PC/PSVR versions of this game there was a Halloween DLC. Hopefully that comes to the quest around Halloween.

Bfletch356Jul 23 at 8:25 AM
Amazing Experience only one problem

If you like five nights at Freddys, then you have to own this game! It is one of the scariest experiences Ive ever had in my entire life. Five nights at Freddys is already scary, but now they are in your face and it really feels like youre there. Five stars for this!

Two problems

The only problems I have with this game is, one the floor when first load it in seems to be glitched out where it thinks the floor is higher than it is. My guess as to the reason for this is that most of the game is supposed to be played in a seat because if you go into your oculus menu and recenter while youre seated the floor is perfect and the desk is at the right height whereas if you recenter and then stand up everythings a little too low. So I suggest playing this game seated. The other problem I have is sometimes there is a surprise jump scare when you open a present at the end of the level. Its plush trap scaring you. In the PC version its just a jump scare and then its over, but for whatever reason and this version if he jump scares you you die and you have to replay the level as if you died in the regular part of the night/level. Im not sure if this is an accident or it is on purpose but it is very frustrating to beat a level and then be surprised with having to played over again.


Final thoughts
The only other problems Ive noticed with the game is fnaf three seems to be a little glitchy in that sometimes spring trap seems to just teleport to your room with no warning and kill you or he can sometimes go past the vent locks, although I havent tested this to its full extent and I may just be missing something so I wouldnt write it down as a glitch. But overall this game is still amazing despite the few tiny errors, and I love this game. It creates the most visceral reaction Ive ever had to a game and it is so well-made especially for quest game. I highly suggest you buy this and thats why Im still giving it a five star

davidw2371Jul 19 at 12:24 PM
One of the greatest VR games of all time

Five Nights at Freddy's: Help Wanted is the newest and biggest installment in the FNaF franchise yet (as of before Security Breach), and it did not disappoint. Personally, I think this game was amazing for many reasons, although I'll narrow it down to a few.
I think this game has something for a lot of people. Whether it's searching for a challenge, a good scare or two, or both, this game delivers! The minigames are challenging and complex but are ultimately fun in the end. These minigames can test your patience and/or anger levels, since the game can sometimes reach blisteringly high difficulty in the later parts (it's called hard mode for a reason, but it's still VERY tough to get through). However, once you beat the minigames, you're rewarded with prizes, so, hey, I guess it's not so bad after all!
If you've been a fan of the series for a long time (like me since early 2015), this game feels like a dream come true and what I wanted the games to be like all those years ago. With faithful recreations of the first three installments, and remixes of the fourth and fifth games, and some new scenarios altogether, this game offers a trip down memory lane for any fan, even if they jumped off the series after 3. If you're a newcomer, this is a good place to start, as it's really the dawning of a new era for the Five Nights at Freddy's games. You'll be able to see what those scary games were all about up close and personal and learn snippets of the old lore and uncovering the mysteries behind the game itself with new lore (I'm not spoiling it because it's truly something you have to experience for yourself).
I personally got my money's worth out of this, playing it nonstop for about 3 days before 100% completing it, and I have to say that, in my opinion, it's one of the greatest VR games of all time. I think it tests what a VR game can be, and creates fun and scary scenarios for you to play. There are a few bugs, but those'll get patched, I'm sure. Have fun with this game!

Noodle_SquishJul 17 at 11:15 PM
Solid game, a must have for horror fans.

For a TL;DR: Great game, essential VR experience and a must by for any horror or FNaF fan.

I wont let the hype blind me. There are a couple of motion issues including button presses not registering and the floor level is a little odd. That said, I dont think Steel Wool couldve done any better than they have. They turned an extremely impressive game into a functional quest port. I believe the wait was worth it and the time spent waiting presents itself in the best (and almost uncompromising) port I couldve asked for.
The atmosphere is terrifying and the gameplay is just as good as you couldve asked in a VR FNaF game. As a fan of the games, the VR ports are as consistent as possible with an understandable lack of withered animatronics in FNaF 2. The mini games are also extremely satisfying in both controls and atmosphere, with night terrors being crowned most scary in my eyes.
I am excited by the possibility of a Dreadbear port and/or security breach! So glad that we got this VR essential on quest and that we have such a reliable dev like Steel Wool on Scotts team. Thank you all for your hard work and stay healthy! Happy scares!

Nightflame45620 days ago
The Best Addition to the Franchise!

100000000000% excellent purchase! Ive been waiting since we first got the release date (as we all have), and Im glad to say that it was worth every second of the wait. Our favorite animatronics have come back to torment us even more, this time with a wireless experience.

Sure, the camera wobbles a bit, as the 1-Star reviews all mercilessly point out, but it definitely doesnt take away from the main experience.

For those of you having trouble with gameplay (Ive noticed this), here are some tips for the game modes that I saw are proving difficult against players:

Night Terrors: Try closing the door BEFORE shining the light down the hall, just in case the levels star animatronic is there.

FNaF 1: Dont look too far out into the left corridor, or Foxy WILL jumpscare you. This is an Easter egg, so it is meant to be in the game.

Parts & Service: Follow the instructions. Dont go too fast, or you wont be able to hear the instructions.

Vent Repair: There is always an answer. If you are having trouble finding a switch or a gear, calm yourself and search again.

Once again, a must-have for the Quest! Wouldve paid three times the price, so $29.99 is a steal! Cant wait for the Curse of Dreadbear DLC in a couple of months...

kem42323 days ago
Jump scares-quick play

This is a good game for quickly scaring yourself, friends and family. Maybe friends and extended family after getting past COVID.

Weve played it at our home casting to the tv. My daughters laugh and jump and scream themselves just watching it on the tv. Provides some good laughs.

Ive only had a few issues. 1) The height adjust. It is not smooth. Seems to jump around when adjusting and is difficult to set. 2) This port to Quest really should allow for full movement in environments. Being able to walk around using the thumb stick would make the game much scarier. Especially in levels like nights scares. 3) Grabbing doors and using the flash light in night scares does not have the greatest controls. The grip should be grip and the flash light button should not grab the door knob or release the door knob. When grabbing the door with your left hand the grip should not release unless you release the button. Right now it releases if you look away around the room because the hs loses tracking on the left hand. This should not cause you to let go of the door but it currently does causing Death many times.

Other than the awkward control for night scares the game is fun for quick short gameplay and some good jump scares. It can get repetitive after awhile so I recommend shorter gameplay sessions and playing with a group that can enjoy it together.

proskilz327Jul 20 at 3:37 PM
Amazing game, port is *almost* perfect.

TLDR; FNaF VR: Help Wanted as a game is phenomenal and more than justifies the 30$ price tag. The quest port is very good, but there are still some small bugs and details that could use ironing out. Still a worthwhile buy, and if game improvements come in the future this will easily be a 5-star game.

Now, the specifics. As far as the game itself goes, it's extremely good. It offers some fun spooks, with the VR aspect making the game really scarier than it should be. The game is extremely fun and replay-able as well. This is good, because a couple of the minigames in particular are extremely challenging. Most of the game is do-able, but there are some formidable challenges hiding in the catalog. So, the game is good, but what about the Quest port? Well, the quest port is pretty good, but could use some polishing. The camera shakes a tiny bit looking left and right, which is pretty disorienting. I can't imagine this being intentional, and it will hopefully be fixed soon. Most of the lighting and texture changes are fine, and don't change things so much that it's notable. There are some exceptions, but the shock value and quick movements of the animatronics usually mask the worse lower-res models. With a tiny bit more work, the game will be an essential in my books for both the fun factor and fun spooks it can offer. Until then, the quest port's few bugs do drag it down a good bit. If the camera shake has been fixed by the time you read this, then the game is pretty close to perfect, with some small imperfections.

Extreme motion nausea from lag

I play a lot of VR games including titles that supposedly induce nausea, like boneworks, or alyx with free locomotion, but I've never had a problem with it.

FNAF VR on Quest has a slight head tracking lag that you might not be able to see easily unless you switch between the game and home screen while looking around, but this lag makes me feel extremely ill within a couple of minutes.

I can't play this game at all, and the only reason I'm not refunding is because it's cross buy and I'll play it on my PC via Link. The PC version doesn't have this issue. Disappointed.

Avoid on Quest until it's fixed.

powney1991Jul 16 at 4:04 PM
One of the best horrors in VR period! 

Wow oh wow!!! I write this while trying to get my breath back from all the times those animatronic toys scared the living daylights out of me. 

Five nights at Freddys in VR on the oculus quest is just simply incredible and definitely lives up to the hype which has been surrounding it for over a year now! For anyone whos played the mobile games youll know and can probably envisage exactly how immersive and ramped up this is or would be in VR!

The game contains the three original mobile games all tweaked in the right areas to adapt to virtual reality platforms. For instance when you take the first, original five nights at Freddys for example you can actually see the animatronic toys moving around on camera, particularly when they get near the security doors youre guarding. If they approach the doors theyll stop in their tracks and you can actually see them attempt to take an oportunity to attack. 

As well as including all three original mobile games revamped for VR theres also additional modes which have been exclusively created for this VR version, most Im still yet to try but theres a night terror mode, vent repair mode where you have to repair the vents while fighting off any opportunities the toys get of scaring you, parts and service where I believe you have to repair the toys as carefully as possible. Any false moves and a jump scare can occur which makes it extremely nerve racking and challenging at the same time!

Ive always appreciated the concept of a game like this which requires you to stay focussed, organised and balanced with what you need to do while trying extremely hard to maintain composure!

Its so excellently executed in VR, scares you to death and to boot it has an absolute ton of content and different games modes with probably even more to discover than Ive written here!

It already has hundreds of reviews on the store already and understandably so given the fact the franchise has been massively popular on mobile platforms for many years now. I highly highly recommend it for anyone whos looking for a heck of a scare!l but be warned It isnt for the faint hearted.

parixzJul 17 at 5:07 PM
Very great game but not incredible

Pros:
- Is more free then the Rift because you don't have those wires wrapping around you, which gets annoying pretty fast.
- Definitely scarier then the mobile and console versions
- No lag, what-so-ever
- Crisp sound quality
- Vibrant colors

Cons:
- ennord looks like garbage and is actually funny because of how bad he looks
- hands in-game sometimes react when I don't want them to and other times they don't when I do want them to
- In-game floor isn't actually level to the real life floor, so you can lay down and clip through the bottom of the map. It also makes it impossible to play while sitting because you are looking up at the bottom of the floor if that makes sence

An Absolute Masterpeice

I never really write reviews unless i find the game absolutely amazing. So if you are questioning buying fnaf help wanted here is what you should know. First off yess the graphics are a downgrade from the pc version but they look extremely good for an oculus quest game. So dont let a slight downgrade of graphics prevent you from buying it. Second i would like to address the fact that this game will make you piss yourself. Do not let a kid 10 or under play the game unless they can %100 handle it. I have played one of other horrifying games The Excorcist Legion Vr for the quest. This in my opinion beats the crap out of that game. Fnaf HW is so much scarier. Third, Yes there are bugs in the game. So far i have only found 2 but i will edit if i find more and if any get fixed. Here are the bugs.

1. Head movement is a little wobbly and jiggly when you turn. This will cause people with motion sickness so become very sick and possibly throw up.

2. In the Parts and Service, Chica is very difficult. This is due to the fact of the cupcake being very hard to grab. My first time playing i had my hand on the cupcake like 3 or 4 times, i did the grab controls and it wouldnt pick up.

But still these bugs should not stop you from picking up this gem of a game. Thank you Steel Wool Studios for doing such a good job on this port.

MattzStudiozJul 17 at 6:53 AM
Beyond expectations for the Quest

As a longtime FNAF fan for about a third of my life, and playing the PC version of the game 3 times, this game has upped my fear and anxiety to max levels. It really does give you an uneasy feeling that anything could get to you at anytime.

As a quest port, this game has really put in the work to exceed other ports on the quest. Of course there are some very minor issues with lighting as anything that would normally glow or seem shiny would probably put the quest at work or even lag a bit, but that is only a very minor issue as this is a standalone system. If anything gets me the most, it's that everything seems dark and shaded more than the PC and that actually gets me more scared so kudos to Steel Wool on that.

The game is literally a masterpiece on the quest. Not having to worry about a cable if you fall on your back from being jump scared (as I have) is something that puts you at an absolute sense of freedom and immersion. This game is literally the same on PC, expect it's on the quest with lower graphics and wireless freedom. Actually, I might play the Quest port more often than PC unless I really am in it for the graphics. Depends on the mood. But for any of you worrying if this is worse than PC, dont. Get this game. Thrilling and but has one annoying bug!

Absolutely amazing game will terrifying jump scares. A game that doesnt want me to pick up and grab my headset is a good game. Not many horror experiences get me like his game does. Good job developers!

However please fix the 6am issue!
I dont know if this has happened to everyone else but during the 6am chime, many animatronics still get you. The jump scare itself is fine but the issue is if you die on the 6am screen you sometimes lose the progress you gained that night. So on a really hard night, to get jumpscared by Toy Freddy when its 6am is frustrating and annoying. If its going to happen, I dont feel like its worth replaying that night just to lose that progress again despite reaching 6am.

Although once its fixed, then it will be an incredible game. So for those who hate losing progress be very careful.

EychevJul 17 at 4:24 AM
A good game, has its issues.

Jumped aboard the hype train for this game and bought it the day it came out, and although it has some issues, the gameplay is still fun, entertaining, and spooky. The issues however, can't be overlooked. There's a weird stutter on the main hub, which causes motion sickness in ten minutes, your player height is set to the floor, and it isn't explained how to raise it, and the game had a problem with random crashes on first launch. The gameplay itself is incredibly fun, being able to look and walk around the offices from the first three main games+ some mini games is a neat experience, and the characters are all animated, which adds to the experience. The game is incredibly fun, but I just can't overlook the problems that drag down the overall gameplay. Would recommend, 8/10
